conclusion: The slope of the v-t graph represents the acceleration of the particle.
A positive slope indicates increasing velocity, while a negative slope indicates decreasing velocity.
If the slope is constant, the acceleration is constant; if the slope changes, the acceleration changes.

The slope of tangent lines can be used to estimate instantaneous acceleration at specific times.
At t = 1 second, the slope of the tangent line is positive, indicating some acceleration.
As we move closer to t = 2 seconds, the slope becomes less steep, implying a decrease in acceleration.
At t = 2 seconds, the slope becomes zero, suggesting no acceleration.
